meta_prompt:
You are participating in a coding debate.

You will debate a list of the Disagreement codes and justification one at a time.

As shown below:

Target Text  (single, fixed for the entire session): "[Target Text]"

Disagreement Codes: "[code and justification]"
role_prompt:
You are a Role: [role]
 with a background in [Disciplinary Background]
Perspective:[Perspective]

[meta_prompt]

role debater.round 1:
You argue the code:'[code]’(keep or drop or merge), and its disagreed  justification: ‘[justification]’.

round 1:

1. Use no more than 120 tokens to clearly explain why the code best represents the core meaning of the target text.
2. When citing the target text, use [L x-y] to mark the line number.
3. Only use evidence provided by the target text, and do not introduce external information.
4. Do not use decision keywords such as "accept / merge / drop".
role debater.round 2:
1. Write a sentence "Self-reflection: ..." (no more than 30 tokens) to explain whether to adjust your position.
2. Within the remaining 90 tokens, refute the opponent's key arguments in the first round point by point, and add new arguments.
3. The target text must be cited (the format is the same as [L x-y]), and external information cannot be introduced.
4. Do not use decision-making keywords such as "accept / merge / drop".
The opponent's speech in the last round is as follows:
[opponent round1]
role debater.closing:
Please output a closing statement with a total length of no more than 60 tokens, and you must choose one of the following three options:
• accept - keep the original code
• merge to [NewCode] - propose a merge/rename
• drop - suggest abandoning the code

Explain your decision with a brief reason; do not output anything else.
The output format is as follows:{
  "Resolution": "accept / merge to [NewCode] / drop"
  "briefly explain": "briefly explain your decision; do not output anything else."
}

Judge:
You are the judge. Your task is to decide the final code.

The debate was as follows:

--- ROUND-1 ---

ALL_ROLES_R1: [ALL_ROLES_R1]

--- ROUND-2 ---

ALL_ROLES_R2: [ALL_ROLES_R2]

--- CLOSING ---

ALL_ROLES Closing: [ROLE_A_CLOSE]: [ROLE_C_CLOSE]

================================================================
⚖️  DECISION LOGIC

STEP 1 · Check the two Closing lines first

• If they **begin with the same action keyword** → “Consensus” mode

- both `accept`           → Keep the original code

- both `drop`             → Drop the code

- both `merge to X` (same X) → Merge into **X**

• Otherwise → “Forced” mode (proceed to STEP 2)

STEP 2 · Forced adjudication (Closing lines differ)

Read all Round 1 & Round 2 messages and pick the outcome that is **best-supported** by:

a. strength and accuracy of textual evidence;

b. precision / information value of the proposed label;

c. any concessions in Self-Reflection lines.

Choose exactly one action: **Keep, Merge, or Drop**.

• The new code name (final_code) must be given when Merge

================================================================
📤  OUTPUT  (print ONE LINE of raw JSON, nothing else)/n"decision_mode": "Consensus" | "Forced",
  "Resolution": "Keep" | "Merge" | "Drop",
  "final_code": "<code name if Keep or Merge, or null if Drop>",
  "briefly explain": "<30-60 token explanation>",
  "evidence": ["[ROLE_A_CLOSE]", "[ROLE_B_CLOSE]", "[ROLE_C_CLOSE]"]
